com.thinkaurelius.titan.core

Interface TitanType

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<TitanElement>, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Element, com.thinkaurelius.titan.util.datastructures.Removable, TitanElement, TitanVertex, com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Vertex
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    TitanKey, TitanLabel

    public interface TitanType
extends TitanVertex
    TitanType defines the schema for TitanRelation. TitanType can be configured through TypeMaker to provide data verification, better storage efficiency, and higher retrieval performance.
    Each TitanRelation has a unique type which defines many important characteristics of that relation.
    • Uniqueness: Defines relations of this type to be unique in the OUTgoing or INcoming direction (isUnique(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Direction)}. If a type is unique, that means there can be at most one relation (i.e. property or edge) of that type on any given element in that direction.
    • Groups: Types can be grouped together for faster retrieval (getGroup()

    TitanTypes are constructed through TypeMaker which is accessed in the context of a TitanTransaction via TitanTransaction.makeType() or through the graph TitanGraph.makeType(). Note, types will only be visible once the transaction in which they were created has been committed.
    TitanType names must be unique in a graph database. Many methods allow the name of the type as an argument instead of the actual type reference.
    Author:
    Matthias Bröcheler (me@matthiasb.com);
    See Also:
    TitanRelation, TypeMaker, Titan Type Wiki

    • Method Detail

      • getName

        String getName()
        Returns the unique name of this type.
        Returns:
        Name of this type.

      • isUnique

        boolean isUnique(com.tinkerpop.blueprints.Direction direction)
        Checks whether this unique in the given direction.

        A type is unique, iff there can be at most one relation (i.e. property or edge) of that type on any given element in that direction. We say that a type is out-unique (in-unique) if it is unique in the OUT direction (resp. IN direction). Specifically, this means:

        • A property key is out-unique, if a vertex has at most one value associated with the key. Birthdate is an example of an out-unique property key since each person has at most one birth date.
        • A property key is in-unique, if at most one vertex can be assigned a given value. Social security number is an example of an in-unique property key since there can only be one person for a particular SSN.
        • An edge lable is out-unique, if a vertex has at most one outgoing edge for that label. Father is an exmaple of a functional edge label, since each person has at most one father.
        Returns:
        true, if the type is unique in the given direction, else false

      • isModifiable

        boolean isModifiable()
        Checks whether relations of this type are modifiable after creation.

        TitanType can be designated non-modifiable which means all of its relation instances cannot be modified after creation.

        Returns:
        true, if relations of this type are modifiable, else false.

      • getGroup

        TypeGroup getGroup()
        Returns the type group of this type.

        TitanTypes can be grouped together which makes it more efficient to retrieve all relations associated with the type group.

        Returns:
        type group of this type.
        See Also:
        TypeGroup
